info.title: Queue OpenAPI for fal-ai/flux-lora-fast-training
info.description: The OpenAPI schema for the fal-ai/flux-lora-fast-training queue.

images_data_url.description:
URL to zip archive with images. Try to use at least 4 images in general the more the better.

        In addition to images the archive can contain text files with captions. Each text file should have the same name as the image file it corresponds to.
images_data_url.title: Images Data Url

is_input_format_already_preprocessed.description: Specifies whether the input data is already in a processed format. When set to False (default), the system expects raw input where image files and their corresponding caption files share the same name (e.g., 'photo.jpg' and 'photo.txt'). Set to True if your data is already in a preprocessed format.
is_input_format_already_preprocessed.title: Is Input Format Already Preprocessed

trigger_word.description:
Trigger word to be used in the captions. If None, a trigger word will not be used.
        If no captions are provide the trigger_word will be used instead of captions. If captions are the trigger word will not be used.
trigger_word.title: Trigger Word

steps.description: Number of steps to train the LoRA on.
steps.title: Steps

data_archive_format.description: The format of the archive. If not specified, the format will be inferred from the URL.
data_archive_format.title: Data Archive Format

is_style.description: If True, the training will be for a style. This will deactivate segmentation, captioning and will use trigger word instead. Use the trigger word to specify the style.
is_style.title: Is Style

create_masks.description: If True segmentation masks will be used in the weight the training loss. For people a face mask is used if possible.
create_masks.title: Create Masks

config_file.description: URL to the training configuration file.
config_file.title: Config File

diffusers_lora_file.description: URL to the trained diffusers lora weights.
diffusers_lora_file.title: Diffusers Lora File

file_size.description: The size of the file in bytes.
file_size.title: File Size

file_name.description: The name of the file. It will be auto-generated if not provided.
file_name.title: File Name

content_type.description: The mime type of the file.
content_type.title: Content Type

url.description: The URL where the file can be downloaded from.
url.title: Url

schema.description: Whether to include logs (`1`) in the response or not (`0`).

success.description: Whether the request was cancelled successfully.
